title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: Working bdl based id codes. data downloading functions require specifying one vector multiple unit variable ids string. recommended use private API key u can get . apply use: options(bdl.api_private_key ="your_key") Also, every function returns data Polish default. like get data English, just add lang = "en" function. metadata information (unit levels, aggregates, NUTS code explanation, etc.) can found .

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: searching unit id, can use two methods: Direct search search_units() Tree listing get_units() Units consist 6 levels: lowest - seventh level separate functions suffix localities. Warning - localities functions different set arguments. Check package API documentation info.

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: Direct searching search_units() takes couple different arguments like: name - required search phrase (can empty string) level - narrows returned units given level . look arguments given function check package API documentation.

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: get units available local data bank run get_units() without argument(warning - can eat data limit fast around 4.5k rows): narrow list add unitParentId. function return children units given parent levels. Add level argument filter units even .

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: Subjects themed directories variables. two searching methods subjects variables: Direct search search_variables() search_subjects() Subject tree listing get_subjects() get_variables()

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: directly search subject just provide search phrase: Subjects consist 3 levels (categories, groups, subgroups) - K, G P respectively. fourth level subject (child subgroup) variables. list top level subjects use get_subjects(): list sub-subjects given category group use get_subjects() parentId argument:

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: Firstly can list variables given subject (subgroup): Secondly, can direct search variables search_variables(). can use empty string name list variables strongly advise around 40 000 rows probably hit data limit. can narrow search given subject - subgroup:

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: picked unit variable codes, ready download data. can two ways: Download data multiple variables single unit get_data_by_unit() Download data single variable multiple units get_data_by_variable()

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: use get_data_by_unit(). specify single unit unitId string argument variables vector strings. Optionally can specify years data. available years used. get information data can add type argument set "label" add additional column variable info.
code: get_data_by_unit(unitId = "023200000000", varId =  "3643") get_data_by_unit(unitId = "023200000000", varId =  c("3643", "2137", "148190")) get_data_by_unit(unitId = "023200000000", varId = "3643", type = "label")

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: use get_data_by_variable(). specify single variable varId string argument. unitParentId provided, function return available units given variable. Setting unitParentId return available children units (levels). narrow unit level set unitLevel. Optionally can specify years data. available years used.
code: get_data_by_variable("420", unitParentId = "011210000000", year = 2013:2016) get_data_by_variable("420", unitLevel = "2", year = 2013:2016)

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: bdl package provides couple additional functions summarizing visualizing data.

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: Data downloaded via get_data_by_unit() get_data_by_variable() locality versions can easily summarized summary():

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: Plotting functions package interfaces data downloading functions. require specifying data_type - method downloading data, rest arguments relevant specify data_type function. Check documentation details. Scatter plot unique - requires vector 2 variables.
code: line_plot(data_type = "unit", unitId = "000000000000", varId = c("415","420")) pie_plot(data_type ="variable" ,"1", "2018",unitParentId="042214300000", unitLevel = "6") scatter_2var_plot(data_type ="variable" ,c("60559","415"), unitLevel = "2")

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: bdl package comes bdl.maps dataset containing spatial maps Poland’s level. generate_map() use generate maps filled bdl data. Use unitLevel change type map. lower level chosen, map generation can time consuming spatial data process. function download load maps automatically. case errors can download manually . Download data file double-click load environment.

title: Downloading and using data from bdl
text: Downloading functions get_data_by_unit() get_data_by_variable() alternative “multi” downloading mode. Function work example single unit, provided vector make additional column values unit provided: multiple variables get_data_by_variable(): mode works locality version well. consistent method downloading multiple variables multiple units provided get_panel_data() function: offers also parameter ggplot = TRUE produces output long form suitable plotting ggplot package:
code: get_data_by_unit(unitId = c("023200000000", "020800000000"), varId =  c("3643", "2137", "148190")) get_data_by_variable(varId =c("3643","420"), unitParentId = "010000000000") get_panel_data(unitId = c("030210101000", "030210105000", "030210106000"), varId =  c("60270", "461668"), year = c(2015:2016)) library(ggplot2) df <- get_panel_data(unitId = c("030210101000", "030210105000", "030210106000"), varId =  c("60270", "461668"), year = c(2015:2018), ggplot = TRUE) ggplot(df,aes(x=year, y= values, color = unit)) + geom_line(aes(linetype = variables)) + scale_color_discrete(labels = c("A", "B", "C")) + scale_linetype_discrete(labels = c("X", "Y"))

title: Authors and Citation
text: Marzena Szpadel. Author. Krzysztof Kania. Author, maintainer. Statistics Poland. Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Szpadel M, Kania K (2023). bdl: Interface Tools 'BDL' API. R package version 1.0.5, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=bdl.
code: @Manual{,   title = {bdl: Interface and Tools for 'BDL' API},   author = {Marzena Szpadel and Krzysztof Kania},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.0.5},   url = {https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=bdl}, }

title: Interface and Tools for BDL API
text: bdl package interface Local Data Bank (Bank Danych Lokalnych - bdl) API. set tools includes: quick plots maps generation, usage datasets data bank. information use tool included built-R help documentation package webpage https://statisticspoland.github.io/R_Package_to_API_BDL/. Try info metadata can found https://bdl.stat.gov.pl/BDL/start.

title: Interface and Tools for BDL API
text: install package run commands: Windows Mac Linux installation remotes work, try installing package manually downloading source package https://github.com/statisticspoland/R_Package_to_API_BDL/releases/download/1.0.5/bdl_1.0.5.zip executing
code: # install.packages("remotes", type = "binary") remotes::install_github("statisticspoland/R_Package_to_API_BDL", upgrade = "always", type = "binary") # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("statisticspoland/R_Package_to_API_BDL") install.packages("path_to_file/bdl_1.0.5.zip", repos = NULL, type = "source")

what: bdl: Interface and Tools for 'BDL' API — bdl
title: bdl: Interface and Tools for 'BDL' API — bdl
text: Interface Local Data Bank ('Bank Danych Lokalnych' - 'bdl') API https://api.stat.gov.pl/Home/BdlApi?lang=en set useful tools like quick plotting map generating using data bank.

title: bdl: Interface and Tools for 'BDL' API — bdl
text: `bdl.api_private_key` String BDL API key can get https://api.stat.gov.pl/Home/BdlApi?lang=en  Example: options(bdl.api_private_key = "11111111-2222-3333-4444-555555555555")

title: bdl: Interface and Tools for 'BDL' API — bdl
text: Maintainer: Krzysztof Kania contact@krzysztofkania.com Authors: Marzena Szpadel M.Szpadel@stat.gov.pl contributors: Statistics Poland [copyright holder, funder]

title: Generate quick map — generate_map
text: Generate given NUTS level map data given variable

title: Generate quick map — generate_map
code: generate_map(   varId,   year,   unitLevel = 2,   unitParentId = NULL,   aggregateId = NULL,   palette = "Blues",   style = NULL,   n = 10,   names = FALSE,   borderLevel = NULL,   lang = c("pl", "en"),   ... )

title: Generate quick map — generate_map
text: varId single variable Id. Use search_variables get_variables find variable id code. year single year 2010-2023 range. unitLevel map data NUTS level - number 1 6. Use get_levels find info. unitParentId 12 character NUTS id code interested unit. Use search_units get_units find unit id code. aggregateId aggregate id. Use get_aggregates info. palette palette name vector colors. See tmaptools::palette_explorer() named palettes. Use "-" prefix reverse palette. style Method process color scale. Options available "sd", "equal", "pretty",  "quantile", "kmeans", "hclust", "bclust", "fisher", "jenks", "log10_pretty". n Preferred number classes. Default 10. names Logical determines whether unit names shown. borderLevel Adds contours units specified level - number 1 6.  Use get_levels find info. lang language returned data, "pl" (default), "en" ... arguments passed GET. example proxy parameters, see details.

title: Generate quick map — generate_map
text: tmap map.

title: Generate quick map — generate_map
text: Generate quickly map given NUTS level, using BDL data. Default level 2. Maps available year: 2010-2020 Provide unit parent id narrow map specific regions. Generating lower (levels 5 6) level maps can take time. function requires external map data "bdl.maps" loaded global environment.    can get data :   Map    download.   Download data double-click load environment. use proxy connect, use_proxy can   passed GET. example   get_request(id, filters,   config = httr::use_proxy(url, port, username, password)).

text: Retrieve data given units BDL specified format.

title: Get data by unit Id's from BDL API — get_data_by_unit
code: get_data_by_unit(   unitId,   varId,   year = NULL,   type = c("code", "label"),   aggregateId = NULL,   lang = c("pl", "en"),   ... )

title: Get data by unit Id's from BDL API — get_data_by_unit
text: unitId single 12 character NUTS id code vector  multiple unit id  codes. multiple unit codes used, columns available. Use search_units get_units find unit id code. varId vector variable Id's.Use search_variables get_variables find variable id code. year vector years. NULL (default) returns data available years. type type variables returned, "code" (default), "label" aggregateId aggregate id. Use get_aggregates info. lang language returned data, "pl" (default), "en" ... arguments passed GET. example proxy parameters, see details.

title: Get data by unit Id's from BDL API — get_data_by_unit
text: dataset tibble.

title: Get data by unit Id's from BDL API — get_data_by_unit
text: Data retrieve     BDL Web Services can filtered arguments. get JSON data specified   directory custom filters use get_request directly. use proxy connect, use_proxy can   passed GET. example   get_request(id, filters,   config = httr::use_proxy(url, port, username, password)).

title: Get data by unit Id's from BDL API — get_data_by_unit

title: Get data by variable Id from BDL API — get_data_by_variable
text: varId single variable Id vector multiple variable id's. multiple id's used, columns available. Use search_variables get_variables find variable id code. unitParentId 12 character NUTS id code parent unit. Use search_units get_units find unit id code. NULL (default) unitLevel set , returns available units variable. unitLevel number 0 6, filters returned unit level. NULL (default) level filters apply. Use get_levels find info. year vector years. NULL (default) returns data available years. aggregateId aggregate id. Use get_aggregates info. lang language returned data, "pl" (default), "en" ... arguments passed GET. example proxy parameters, see details.

text: Retrieve data BDL API JSON format.

title: Get JSON response from BDL API — get_request
Get JSON response from BDL API — get_request
text: dir directory dataset. id name dataset interested. filters named list filters. Names list objects bdl filter names values vectors specified filter values. NULL (default) whole dataset returned. See API documentation filters limitations per query. ... arguments passed GET. example proxy parameters, see details.

title: Get JSON response from BDL API — get_request
text: JSON raw data.

title: Get JSON response from BDL API — get_request
text: Data retrieve     BDL Web Services can specified filters. specific filters   required, recommended use data query like get_data_by_unit_locality,   use get_request directly. use proxy connect, use_proxy can   passed GET. example   get_request(id, filters,   config = httr::use_proxy(url, port, username, password)).

title: Get JSON response from BDL API — get_request
code: # get_request(dir = "data/By-Variable", id = "3643")    # get_request(dir = "data/By-Unit", id = "023200000000", filters = list(year  = c("2000","2010"),     #             var-Id" = c("2137","148190")))    # get_request(dir = "data/By-Variable", id = "3643", filters = list(year = c("2000","2010"),     #             unit-Level" = 2, lang = "en"))

title: Generate quick line plot — line_plot
text: Generate line plot one unit/multiple variables variable/multiple units

title: Generate quick line plot — line_plot
code: line_plot(   data_type = c("unit", "unit.locality", "variable", "variable.locality"),   unitId = NULL,   varId = NULL,   year = NULL,   aggregateId = NULL,   lang = NULL,   unitParentId = NULL,   unitLevel = NULL,   ... )

title: Generate quick line plot — line_plot
text: data_type type data used generating plot, "unit"(default), "unit.locality","variable","variable.locality" unitId 12 character NUTS unit id locality  12 character id 7 characters locality individual id, separated dash. varId vector variable Id's (data_type equal "unit" "unit.locality)  single variable (data_type equal "variable" "variable.locality"). Use search_variables get_variables find variable id code. year vector years. NULL (default) returns data available years. aggregateId aggregate id. Use get_aggregates info. lang language returned data, "pl" (default), "en" unitParentId 12 character NUTS id code interested unit. (Used data_type equal "variable" "variable.locality") Use search_units get_units find unit id code. unitLevel number 0 6, filters returned unit level. (Used data_type equal "variable") NULL (default) level filters apply. Use get_levels find info. ... arguments passed GET. example proxy parameters, see details.

title: Generate quick line plot — line_plot
text: ggplot2 plot.

title: Generate quick line plot — line_plot

title: Generate quick pie plot — pie_plot
text: data_type type data used generating plot, "variable"(default), "variable","variable.locality" varId variable Id. Use search_variables get_variables find variable id code. year single year. NULL (default) returns data available years. unitParentId 12 character NUTS id code interested unit. Use search_units get_units find unit id code. unitLevel number 0 6, filters returned unit level.  (Used data_type equal "variable") NULL (default) level filters apply. Use get_levels find info. aggregateId aggregate id. Use get_aggregates info. label Logical; TRUE (default) adds labels. lang language returned data, "pl" (default), "en" ... arguments passed GET. example proxy parameters, see details.

title: Generate quick pie plot — pie_plot

title: bdl 1.0.5
text: generate_map() now supports 2022-2024 data

title: bdl 1.0.4
text: CRAN release: 2022-02-01 Now multi-page queries show progress bar generate_map() now supports 2021 data Bugfixes

title: bdl 1.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2021-03-02 Bugfixes

title: bdl 1.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-04-01 Bugfixes Improved labeling functions Improved styling Imroved mapping functions Removed unnecessary dependencies

title: bdl 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-02-29 Improved variable label function informative Fixed lang parameter pass visualisation functions Added new parameters generate_map() Various fixes plot functions Updated DESCRIPTION Added new function get_panel_data() thanks @IwoA Improved multi variable/unit downloading Added new maps 2019 2020 Redisgned map downloading system

title: bdl 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-09-19 Increased map year range 2010-2018 New maps level 5 6 Various fixes documentation New package site available https://statisticspoland.github.io/R_Package_to_API_BDL/

title: bdl 0.0.3
text: Initial release.
